on reading compounds: 両【リョウ】both (hands, parents, sides, etc.), counter for carriages (e.g. in a train), counter for vehicles, ryō, tael, traditional unit of weight (for gold, silver and drugs), 4-5 monme, 15-19 g, ryō, pre-Meiji unit of currency, orig. the value of one ryō of gold, ryō, traditional measure of fabric, 2 tan, ryō, tael, unit of weight under the Ritsuryo system, 1/16 kin, 42-43 g
両足【リョウソク】both feet, both legs
一両【イチリョウ】one vehicle, one ryou (an old coin)
十両【ジュウリョウ】second highest division, wrestlers of the second highest division
